reviews.text: Stayed here on our first stop on Route 66. Hotel was walking distance to downtown Springfield. Staff were
reviews.title: Terrific location, good breakfast, large rooms

reviews.text: rather disinterested, but that doesn't bother us too much. Rooms were large, but outdated. They we're clean with
reviews.title: Clean room, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: the exception of the windows which were smeared with fingermarks. Good facilities at the hotel and room rates
reviews.title: For the price, this place is a jewel

reviews.text: we're very reasonable for what you got.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: We spent the night here while in Springfield for a funeral. The front desk staff on August 31st, was very helpful with places to go for dinner, letting us read all the menus she had while offering suggestions in town. The rooms were nice, clean and comfortable except for the air conditioning which did not work. After calling down to the desk, we were moved to another room in which one did work and got an apology from her also, wasn't her fault that they did not work, but she was very gracious about it. The next morning I went down for coffee and snack to take to the room while relaxing before we had to leave. The selection was not much but it was a bit to tide us over til lunch. The location was nice and quiet and we would stay there again as we would like to come back to do explore more as the town seemed to have a lot to offer.
reviews.title: Great place to relax.

reviews.text: was recommended from a friend, and yes 5Star+ for sure!! Great location, great hot breakfast, wifi, clean, all those important things we need. Then the icing on the cake is the friendly and professional staff, Jade, Calos, Francis, were just a few of the names, everyone was very helpful.
reviews.title: They make you feel like family!

reviews.text: I will be back for sure!!
reviews.title: Very clean, modern and comfortable

reviews.text: I was staying at a buggy, filthy hotel down the street and Carpenter Street Hotel found a room for us at the last minute during fair week. Tabitha was wonderful as were the front desk girls the night before. Everything was modern, clean and comfortable. I wish we had stayed here first. We will be back. Thank you!
reviews.title: The simple way is the best way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly, the room was clean and it was close to the Lincoln museum- what more could you want? Tabatha went out of her way to make my 9 years old day with a special treat! I appreciated her efforts. Tabatha was great! My son is still smiling! Thanks again.
reviews.title: Terrific

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean, the help was accommodating, Close to downtown historical sites, and the front desk evening lady, Tabatha was extremely helpful and considerate. As for cost this hotel is the best bang for your buck. My wife and I had a great two day stay.
reviews.title: It didn't kill me, but I won't go back.

reviews.text: The hotel is close enough to the Lincoln Library and Museum that you can walk to it. Springfield seems like kind of a depressed area and when we arrived on a Sunday evening we found it hard to find an open restaurant nearby. That's not the hotel's fault, of course. The rooms were fine and the hotel staff was welcoming. A breakfast they ran out of instant oatmeal which is what our son normally eats for breakfast. They were apologetic about it. Other than that the breakfast was fairly standard for a continental-cold cereal, sugary yogurt, microwaved omelets/eggs and not enough fruit.
reviews.title: Close to downtown
Fresh, clean, modern, well-located hotel
reviews.text: We enjoyed our night's stay in this lovely hotel. The desk staff was friendly and professional. The rooms are clean and well appointed with a desk and very nice desk chair, lounge chair and ottoman, two queens and a flat screen TV and free high speed Internet. The breakfast was good with scrambled eggs and sausage as well as all the other usual continental breakfast fare. It is well located, only 1.5 blocks from the Lincoln Library and Museum. The only thing that kept this hotel from being a five is there was no refrigerator.

I spent 6 days at this hotel I have never met such nice, friendly, helpful and courteous staff at a hotel before. They went out of their way to make our stay easier. My mother was in St. John's in very serious condition. We did not have to worry about anything concerning our hotel stay. The courtesy breakfast each morning was just what we needed to start the day and we didn't have to drive to get it. I did not use the shuttle service but it was nice to know it was there if needed. Thank you for being a GREAT hotel.
reviews.title: Super Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel is sparkling clean with pretty rooms and a very nice staff. I was able to walk to the Lincoln museum and library complex, but it is a quick jaunt by car to other downtown attractions if you don't feel like driving. I used the workout room (very satisfactory) ate a basic -- but good breakfast -- in the dining area. As a woman traveling alone, I didn't know what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised. I felt safe, slept well and couldn't help but notice how clean it was (very important to me)!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: The girls at the desk are extremely nice and look after your needs, as does the cleaning staff. Everyone was helpful including Tabitha, Monica, Jane and Trevana.
reviews.title: Unpretentious and a Good Value

reviews.text: You won't easily find this hotel against the backdrop of all the national chains. However, give this property a second look; you will be pleased. Rates are affordable as there is no frachise fee that has to be paid. It's location is close to everything downtown in the historic district and within walking distance (convenient). The rooms are big and spacious, clean, great towels, beds comfortable, great pillows, and quiet (rooms specific and hotel in general). Our room had a mini frig and microwave which was very convenient. This is not the place for unbrittled little kids. But for those with teenagers on up or empty nesters, this is the place to stay. It is so quiet, you will feel like you have the place to yourself. The staff is personable and outgoing. The breakfast was good and each day something different is featured. We would definitely stay here the next time we visit Springfield. In fact, we would gladly recommend this property to others.
reviews.title: Hidden Diamond in Springfield

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here in a king room. It was clean and updated and the bathtub and shower looked brand new. The standards in the room are much more upscale than the building would lead you to believe. There is a chair and ottoman, a desk and ergonomic chair and a comfortable bed with white bedding.
reviews.title: More than expected

reviews.text: The room also has a mini-fridge, microwave and coffeepot.
reviews.title: Respectable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was standard free fare with two hot dishes, scrambled eggs with cheese and potatoes.
reviews.title: Convenient for Lincoln Museum and Library

reviews.text: I had a bagel and coffee which is my usual but my husband enjoyed the eggs and potatoes.
reviews.title: clean and reasonable
